soc.game

Class SOCGame.RollResult

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.game.SOCGame.RollResult
  • Enclosing class:
    SOCGame

    public static class SOCGame.RollResult
extends java.lang.Object
    Dice roll result, for reporting from SOCGame.rollDice(). Each game has 1 instance of this object, which is updated each turn.
    Since:
    2.0.00
    Author:
    Jeremy D Monin <jeremy@nand.net>
    See Also:
    SOCPlayer.getRolledResources(), SOCMoveRobberResult

    • Field Summary

      java.util.List<SOCVillage> clothVillages
      Null, empty, or any village(s) with matching dice numbers which had cloth remaining, and may have distributed some of the cloth in cloth and changed their SOCVillage.getCloth() amounts.

      The dice numbers rolled, each 1 to 6.

      The dice numbers rolled, each 1 to 6.

    • Field Detail

      • diceA

        public int diceA
        The dice numbers rolled, each 1 to 6.

      • diceB

        public int diceB
        The dice numbers rolled, each 1 to 6.

      • cloth

        public int[] cloth
        Null, or distributed cloth (for game scenario SC_CLVI) in this format: [ Cloth amount taken from general supply, Cloth amount given to player 0, to player 1, ..., to player n ]. Any SOCVillages with matching dice numbers which took part are in clothVillages.
        See Also:
        SOCBoardAtServer.distributeClothFromRoll(SOCGame, SOCGame.RollResult, int)

      • clothVillages

        public java.util.List<SOCVillage> clothVillages
        Null, empty, or any village(s) with matching dice numbers which had cloth remaining, and may have distributed some of the cloth in cloth and changed their SOCVillage.getCloth() amounts.

        The 4-player board won't put more than 1 village in this list, but the 6-player layout has dice numbers with multiple villages.

      • sc_robPossibleVictims

        public java.util.List<SOCPlayer> sc_robPossibleVictims
        Robber/pirate fleet victims in some scenarios, otherwise null.

        When a 7 is rolled in game scenario SC_PIRI, there is no robber piece to move; the current player immediately picks another player with resources to steal from. In that situation, this field holds the list of possible victims, and gameState is GameState.WAITING_FOR_ROB_CHOOSE_PLAYER.

        Moving the pirate fleet might also have a different victim: See sc_piri_fleetAttackVictim, sc_piri_fleetAttackRsrcs, and SOCMoveRobberResult.sc_piri_loot.

        See Also:
        SOCGame.getPossibleVictims()

      • sc_piri_fleetAttackVictim

        public SOCPlayer sc_piri_fleetAttackVictim
        When the pirate fleet moves in game scenario SC_PIRI, they may attack the player with an adjacent settlement or city. If no adjacent, or more than 1, nothing happens, and this field is null. Otherwise see sc_piri_fleetAttackRsrcs for the result; The "victim" may win the battle and gain resource picks. See also SOCMoveRobberResult.sc_piri_loot.

        Each time the dice is rolled, the fleet is moved and this field is updated; may be null. For robbery behavior when 7 is rolled, see sc_robPossibleVictims.

      • sc_piri_fleetAttackRsrcs

        public SOCResourceSet sc_piri_fleetAttackRsrcs
        When the pirate fleet moves in game scenario SC_PIRI, resources lost when they attack the player with an adjacent settlement or city (sc_piri_fleetAttackVictim).

        Each time the dice is rolled, the fleet is moved and this field is updated; may be null.

        If the victim wins against the attack, they must soon be prompted to gain a resource of their choice. This resource set contains SOCResourceConstants.GOLD_LOCAL to indicate the win. State became GameState.WAITING_FOR_PICK_GOLD_RESOURCE and the caller of SOCGame.rollDice() must prompt the player to choose their free resource.
